message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.CYBER, cs.IR, cs.CL

The paper discusses the design and analysis of a platform for tracking online misinformation and fact-checking efforts. This involves the collection and detection of online misinformation, which falls under the category of social media analysis (cs.SOC) and cybercrime (cs.CYBER). The platform also involves natural language processing (cs.CL) for analyzing the content of tweets and identifying fake news. Additionally, the study involves information retrieval (cs.IR) for analyzing the spread of misinformation and fact-checking content. Finally, the study involves the analysis of social dynamics (cs.SI) in the sharing of fake news and fact-checking content.
